description:
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swinging_(sexual_practice)]Swinging[/url] or (rarely) partner swapping is a non-monogamous behavior, in which singles or partners in a committed relationship engage in sexual activities with others as a recreational or social activity.

Swinging can take place in a number of contexts, ranging from spontaneous sexual activity at informal gatherings of friends to planned regular social meetings to hooking up with like-minded people at a swingers' club. It can also involve Internet-based swinger social networking services online.

The older term wife-swapping, once considered to be equivalent to "swinging", is criticized today as being androcentric where it is presumed that the partners are a married heterosexual couple and that it is the male who is in control of the sexual activities and also that it does not accurately describe the full range of sexual activities in which both singles or couples may take part.

Note: Do not confuse swinging with [url=https://vndb.org/i772]Infidelity[/url].
name: Swinging

description:
[URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Z%C5%8Dri]Zouri[/URL] are flat and thonged Japanese sandals made of rice straw or other plant fibers, cloth, lacquered wood, leather, rubber, or synthetic materials. Zouri are quite similar to flip-flops.

The traditional forms of zouri are seen when worn with other traditional clothing; modern forms are fairly common, especially in summer. While [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geta_%28footwear%29]geta[/URL] are nowadays worn with the informal yukata, zouri are associated with the more formal kimono.
name: Zouri

description:
This character is a hardworking person.

Hardworker refers to a person that spends a lot of effort to succeed at the assigned tasks and achieve his/her goals.
name: Hardworker
School "Go Home Club" Member
aliases: Not a Member of the School Club
description:
This character is actually not a member of any club. 

Please use this trait only in the cases when it is an important part of the plot (eg, a character is trained as a magician in his spare time after school), or when it somehow reveals the traits of the character's personality (eg, a character is too lazy to participate in club activities, and even being criticized by people around because of this).

Also, the name of this trait implies that a character should at least attend school, rather than completely ignore the classes together with clubs.

If a character is a member of a club, just refuses to actually show up for the activities of his/her club, then use [url=http://vndb.org/i1320]Ghost Member of the School Club[/url] instead.

name: Primate
description:
This characters is or shares a resmblance to a   [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Primate]primate[/url].

Primates are the family group of species like Apes, Monkeys, Lemurs etc.

The [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drum]drum[/url] is a member of the percussion group of musical instruments. In the Hornbostel-Sachs classification system, it is a membranophone. Drums consist of at least one membrane, called a drumhead or drum skin, that is stretched over a shell and struck, either directly with the player's hands, or with a drum stick, to produce sound. There is usually a resonance head on the underside of the drum, typically tuned to a slightly lower pitch than the top drumhead. Other techniques have been used to cause drums to make sound, such as the thumb roll. Drums are the world's oldest and most ubiquitous musical instruments, and the basic design has remained virtually unchanged for thousands of years.

Drums may be played individually, with the player using a single drum, and some drums such as the djembe are almost always played in this way. Others are normally played in a set of two or more, all played by the one player, such as bongo drums and timpani. A number of different drums together with cymbals form the basic modern drum kit.
name: Drum

description:
[url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prayer_beads]Prayer beads[/url] are a part of this characters clothing and accessories.

Prayer beads are used by members of various religious traditions such as Hinduism, Buddhism, Christianity, Islam, Sikhism and the Bahá'í Faith to mark the repetitions of prayers, chants or devotions, such as the rosary of Virgin Mary in Catholicism, and dhikr (remembrance of God) in Islam.
name: Prayer Beads

description:
This character is subject of a sexual scene involving adult breast feeding. Apply i2210 to the performing character.

[url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erotic_lactation]Erotic lactation[/url] also called adult breast feeding is sexual arousal by breastfeeding on a female's breast.

Breast feeding is the act of sucking on the breast directly and does not require any milk to be visible or present. In hentai many times the fetish work around the fact of being treated as a child sucking on mother's brest. This tag must be used only in case of fetish and sexual breast feeding and not just normal child mother breast feeding.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/49/95949.jpg]NSFW Example 1[/url]
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/51/95951.jpg]NSFW Example 2[/url]
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/50/95950.jpg]NSFW Example 3[/url]
name: Adult Breast Feeding

description:
This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_cleaning]housekeeping[/url] or cleaning of other places in a similar manner, like a classroom.

Housekeeping is the act of cleaning the rooms and furnishings of a home. It is one of the many chores included in the term housework. Housecleaning includes activities such as disposing of rubbish, cleaning dirty surfaces, dusting and vacuuming. It may also involve some outdoor chores, such as removing leaves from rain gutters, washing windows and sweeping doormats.
name: Cleaning

description: A tactical suit is a complete line of clothing, footwear, and other safety gear designed for military, law enforcement and firefighting professionals.
name: Tactical Suit
German
description: This character is of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germans]German[/url] descent.
This character has fangs, or only one fang for cuteness.
name: Fang

description:
The character is [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curse]cursed[/url].

A curse is any expressed wish that some form of adversity or misfortune will befall or attach to some other entity—one or more persons, a place, or an object. In particular, "curse" may refer to a wish that harm or hurt will be inflicted by any supernatural powers, such as a spell, a prayer, an imprecation, an execration, magic, witchcraft, a god, a natural force, or a spirit. In many belief systems, the curse itself (or accompanying ritual) is considered to have some causative force in the result.

This trait applies only to characters that are actually cursed by supernatural means, not just jokingly cursed by other characters.
name: Curse

description:
This character has thick eyebrows.

Example: [url=https://vndb.org/c14849]Captain Doristram[/url]
name: Thick Eyebrows

description:
A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shikigami]shikigami[/url] (spirit servant) is a spirit that can be summoned and controlled by a [url=https://vndb.org/i388]onmyouji[/url], like familiar are summoned by warlocks in occidental witchcraft. 
Shikigami's are invisible to the majority of people but they can assume physical human or animal form if ordered by the onmyouji.

Shikigami must be conjured during a complex ceremony and their power is connected to the spiritual force of their master. If the evoker is well introduced and has lots of experience, his Shikigami can possess animals and even people and manipulate them. But if the evoker is careless, his shikigami may get out of control in time, gaining its own will and consciousness. In this case the shikigami will raid its own master and kill him in revenge. Normally shikigami are conjured to exercise risky orders for their masters, such as spying around, stealing and enemy tracking.
name: Shikigami
Street Racing
description:
This person occasionally or regularly participates in [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Street_racing]street races[/url].

Street racing is an unsanctioned and illegal form of motor racing that occurs on a public road.

These are traits about [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Group_sex]group sex[/url].

Group sex is sexual behavior involving more than two participants. Group sex can occur amongst people of all sexual orientations and genders.

The following traits are for the passive or receiving participant(s). Traits for the active or performing participant(s) are under [url=/i43]Engages in (Sexual)[/url] > [url=/i105]Group Sex[/url]. If you apply any of the following traits to a character, also apply [url=/i43]Engages in (Sexual)[/url] > [url=/i105]Group Sex[/url] to them.
name: Group Sex
School Extraordinary Club President
description: This character is the president of a club that would not be found in a real Japanese school. For example, an occult club, a sexual humiliation club, a gambling club, etc. These clubs might be official or not.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Police_officer]police officer[/url].

A police officer is a warranted employee of a police force. Police officers are generally charged with the apprehension of criminals and the prevention and detection of crime, and the maintenance of public order.
name: Police
Sororicide
description: [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sororicide]Sororicide[/URL] is the act of killing one's own sister.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clergy_shirt]clerical clothing[/url].

Collarino is probably the most common type of shirt and collar among Roman Catholic clergy. It resembles a standard dress shirt, but has a standing black collar that is sewn to accommodate a white cloth or soft plastic insert, leaving a small white square at the base of the throat.
name: Collarino

description:
This is a meta trait to gather all [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smoking]smoking[/url] related traits.

Smoking is a practice in which a substance, most commonly tobacco, is burned and the smoke is tasted or inhaled. This is primarily practised as a route of administration for recreational drug use, as combustion releases the active substances in drugs such as nicotine and makes them available for absorption through the lungs. It can also be done as a part of rituals, to induce trances and spiritual enlightenment.
name: Smokes
University Student
description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University]university[/url] [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Student]student[/url].

A student is a learner, or someone who attends an educational institution.

A university is an institution of higher education and research, which grants academic degrees in a variety of subjects. A university is a corporation that provides both undergraduate education and postgraduate education.

name: Whipping
description:
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flagellation]Flagellation[/url] (Latin flagellum, "whip"), flogging, whipping or lashing is the act of methodically beating the human body with special implements such as whips, lashes, rods, switches, the cat o' nine tails, the sjambok, etc. 

Typically, flogging is imposed on an unwilling subject as a punishment; however, it can also be submitted to willingly, or performed on oneself, in religious or sadomasochistic contexts.

name: Enchainment
description:
Enchainment is the process in which a person is usually binded in chain with the usual intention of torture and confine. The trait can also be used if chains are connected to handcuffs, shackles and other similarly conceived restraint devices that function in a similar manner.

This trait should not be used in place of i1194 because this trait does not involve sex; it could be used in conjuction though if needed. 
In case of pillory or stocks use the specific trait (i1678).

This character often makes [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sarcasm]sarcastic[/url] remarks.

Sarcasm is “a sharp, bitter, or cutting expression or remark; a bitter jibe or taunt.” Though irony is usually the immediate context, most authorities sharply distinguish sarcasm from irony; however, others argue that sarcasm may or often does involve irony or employs ambivalence. Sarcasm has been suggested as a possible bullying action in some circumstances.
name: Sarcasm
Hairpin
description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hairpin_(fashion)]hair pin[/url].

A hairpin is a long device used to hold a person's hair in place. The hairpin may be decorative and encrusted with jewels and ornaments, or it may be utiliarian, and designed to be almost invisible while holding a hairstyle in place.

Some hairpins are a single straight pin, but modern versions are more likely to be constructed from different lengths of wire that are bent in half with a u-shaped end and a few kinks along the two opposite portions. The finished pin may vary from two to six inches in final length. The length of the wires enables placement in several styles of hairdos to hold the style in place. The kinks enable retaining the pin during normal movements.

name: Armband
description:
This character wears an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armband]armband[/url]

An armband is a piece of material worn around the arm over the sleeve of other clothing if present. they may be worn for pure ornamentation to mark the wearer as belonging to group, having a certain rank or role, or being in a particular state or condition.

name: Apostasy
description: This character abandons their religious beliefs or lifestyle at some point in the story. This does not need to be a complete or permanent change.

name: Weak Memory
description:
This character is often forgets to do something or cannot remember what people had told him. This can be caused by several health problems, magic or anything else.

Note: If it's a one-time only loss of memory, use [url=http://vndb.org/i91]Amnesia[/url] instead. If the character is a careless scatterbrain, who generally doesn't pay attention to things, and not an actual health problem, then use [url=http://vndb.org/i929]Absentminded[/url] trait instead.

name: Mature
description:
This character has a mature personality.

In terms of personality, is a person fully developed in terms of thinking. If used to refer to a young person, his/her behavior is not typical of it's age, as this person usually acts like a grown up or a more aged and wised one.

name: Vindictive
description:
This character has a [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/vindictive]vindictive[/url] nature.

This trait can divined in two ways:


1. disposed or inclined to revenge; vengeful (a vindictive person). 
2. proceeding from or showing a revengeful spirit (vindictive rumors).

name: Mentor
description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mentor]mentor[/url].

A mentor is a trusted friend, counselor or teacher, usually a more experienced person.

Some professions have "mentoring programs" in which newcomers are paired with more experienced people, who advise them and serve as examples as they advance. Schools sometimes offer mentoring programs to new students, or students having difficulties.

Today mentors provide expertise to less experienced individuals to help them advance their careers, enhance their education, and build their networks.

name: Torture
description:
This character is subjected to [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Torture]torture[/url].

Torture is any act by which severe pain or suffering, whether physical or mental, is intentionally inflicted on a person for such purposes as obtaining from him, or a third person, information or a confession, punishing him for an act he or a third person has committed or is suspected of having committed, or intimidating or coercing him or a third person, or for any reason based on discrimination of any kind, when such pain or suffering is inflicted by or at the instigation of or with the consent or acquiescence of a public official or other person acting in an official capacity. It does not include pain or suffering arising only from, inherent in, or incidental to, lawful sanctions. 

[From UN Convention Against Torture]

This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extraterrestrial_life]extraterrestrial[/url].

Extraterrestrial life is defined as life that does not originate from Earth.

Hypothetical forms of extraterrestrial life range from simple bacteria-like organisms to sapient beings far more advanced than humans. It is currently unknown whether any such forms of life exist or ever existed.
name: Extraterrestrial
Microskirt
description:
A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microskirt]microskirt or micro-miniskirt[/url] is a very short skirt, being shorter than a miniskirt, being less than 8 inches (20 cm) in length. The microskirt is sometimes humorously referred to as a beltskirt and is described as more an evocation of the idea of a skirt than something that covers anything substantial.

At that length, if the wearer has bare legs, the microskirt exposes the thighs and the lower portion of the buttocks, as well as part of the undergarment(s), with even more being exposed if the wearer bends down. To avoid exposure of buttocks and undergarment(s), a microskirt may be worn with tights, leggings, shorts or bloomers. Stretch microskirts may be made using spandex material which may be worn in conjunction with hold-ups and a pair of stiletto heel pumps, and sometimes with G-string underwear.

name: Acrobatic Gymnastics
description: The character engages in [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acrobatic_gymnastics]acrobatic gymnastics[/url].

name: Murder
description:
This character commits a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murder]murder[/url].

Murder is the unlawful killing of another human being with "malice aforethought", and generally this state of mind distinguishes murder from other forms of unlawful homicide (such as manslaughter).

The four states of mind recognized as constituting "malice" are:
    Intent to kill,
    Intent to inflict grievous bodily harm short of death,
    Reckless indifference to an unjustifiably high risk to human life (sometimes described as an "abandoned and malignant heart"), or
    Intent to commit a dangerous felony (the "felony-murder" doctrine).
This character performs a sexual act on a sleeping character, waking them up in the middle of doing so, either intentionally or not. Apply [url=/i1651]i1651[/url] to the character who was asleep.
name: Wake-up Sex
Anilingus
description:
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anilingus]Anilingus[/url] is performed on this character. Apply [url=/i103]i103[/url] to the performing character.

Anilingus is a form of oral sex involving contact between the anus or perineum of one person and the mouth of another.

name: Miko's Dress
description:
This character is seen wearing the long dress of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miko]miko[/url], Japanese priestess.

The traditional attire of a miko would be a pair of red hakama (which are long, divided trousers) or a long red slightly pleated skirt tied with a bow, a white haori (which is a kimono jacket), and some white or red hair ribbons. In Shintoism, the color white symbolizes purity.

This character becomes the victim of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rape]rape[/url] perpetrated by an individual.

In criminal law, rape is a type of sexual assault usually involving sexual intercourse, which is initiated by one or more persons against another person without that person's consent.
name: Rape

description:
This character wears one or more linked body piercings.

Linked body piercings are [url=https://vndb.org/i825]body piercing[/url] linked with each other by a chain or rope. Linked body piercing are commonly used in [url=https://vndb.org/g1117]BDSM[/url] practice. In BDSM community piercings are considered a rite of passage, accepting the pain as pleasure, of the wearer from a stage to another. In hentai usually body piercings and linked piercings mark the final passage from a state of free human being to the one where the wearer accept the fact of being a [url=https://vndb.org/i1879]sexual slave[/url].

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/42/97942.jpg]NSFW Example Tits/Clitoris 1[/url], [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/41/97941.jpg]NSFW Example Tits/Clitoris 2[/url]
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/43/97943.jpg]NSFW Example Tits[/url], [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/44/97944.jpg]NSFW Example Tits[/url]
name: Linked Piercings

description: [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maraca]Maracas[/url], sometimes called Rumba shakers, shac-shacs, and various other names, are rattles which appear in many genres of Caribbean and Latin music. Players hold them by their handles, usually in pairs, and shake them.
name: Maracas

description:
[URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kanzashi]Kanzashi[/URL] are hair ornaments used in traditional Japanese hairstyles. They can act as a pinning device for hairstyles and/or be purely ornamental. Designs vary in complexity, and often have a floral motif.

[URL=https://s.vndb.org/sf/86/79386.jpg]Simple kanzashi example.[/URL]
[URL=https://s.vndb.org/sf/87/79387.jpg]Elaborate kanzashi example.[/URL]
name: Kanzashi
Unnatural Sclera
description: This character's sclera (the white of the eye) is a color that is not found on humans normally.
This character is from the Philippines.
name: Philippine

description:
This character undergoes an [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Abortion#Induced]abortion[/url].

Abortion is the ending of pregnancy by removing a fetus or embryo from the womb before it can survive on its own. Modern methods use medication or surgery for abortions.
name: Abortion
Maou
description:
This character is the king of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demon]demons[/url].

Fiction about demons usually tells of a hierarchy in hell and a demon sits atop of all the others, this king is called Maou, basically the Japanese for demon king.

One thing to note is that Maou should not be mixed with Satan, because while Satan is a unique character from Christian Myth, the king of demons refers to a title held by, (usually) the most powerful demon in a wide range of myths.

This trait is intended to be used for a character who is the actual king of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demon]demons[/url] and not just a normal human who got it as a title, which seems to be a rather common title among dangerous elements.

name: Vaginal Fingering
description:
This character uses their fingers to stimulate another character's [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vagina]vagina[/url] or [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vulva]vulva[/url]. Apply [url=/i1645]i1645[/url] to the receiving character.

[url=/i784]Handjob[/url] may be considered the equivalent trait for a male receiver.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Master_%28form_of_address%29]master[/url].

A master is an employer of workers or servants, usually of a large estate or household.
name: Master
Unofficial School Club Member
description: This character is a member of the school club, the existence of which wasn't approved by the school administration, and thus, this club is considered to be underground. A members of such club are trying to conceal the place and time of club meetings, and they may even be in a state of war with the Student Council and/or Discipline Committee.

This character has sex in a [url=http://www.sexinfo101.com/butterflypositions.shtml]butterfly[/url] position. Apply this trait to the penetrating partner and apply [url=/i1700]i1700[/url] to the penetrated partner.

In a sexual context, "butterfly" may refer to a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Missionary_position#Butterfly_position]specific position[/url] in which the receiving partner lies down, face up, while the penetrating partner stands or kneels on a lower surface. However, this trait (or one of its child traits) should be used for any position in which the receiving partner lies down, face up, while the penetrating partner kneels, squats or stands in front of them with their torso mostly upright. The receiving partner may have their hips raised up or rotated slightly. The penetrating partner may kneel or stand on a lower surface than the receiver so that they are not too high up.

If the penetrating partner is supporting themselves over the top of the receiving partner, consider using the [url=/i1694]missionary[/url] trait instead. If the penetrating partner is standing and the receiving partner's hips are raised far above their shoulders, consider using the [url=/i1696]piledriver[/url] trait instead.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/12/84312.jpg]Example 1[/url] - Penetrating partner standing on a lower surface
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/53/79853.jpg]Example 2[/url] - [url=/i1701]Seventh Posture[/url]
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/13/84313.jpg]Example 3a[/url], [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/14/84314.jpg]Example 3b[/url] - [url=/i1702]Tominagi[/url]
name: Butterfly

description:
This character has sex in the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Woman_on_top#Reverse_cowgirl_position]reverse cowgirl[/url] position. Apply this trait to the penetrating partner and apply [url=/i1069]i1069[/url] to the penetrated partner.

Similarly to the [url=/i1689]cowgirl[/url] position, the penetrating partner lies on their back, while the receiving partner straddles them with their torso mostly upright. Unlike the cowgirl position, the receiving partner faces away.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/35/84135.jpg]Example 1[/url]
name: Reverse Cowgirl
Investigation
description:
This character conducts an [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/Investigation]investigation[/url].

An investigation  is a systematic, minute, and thorough attempt to learn the facts about something complex or hidden. It is often formal and official.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cassock]cassock[/url].

The cassock, an item of clerical clothing, is an ankle-length robe worn by clerics of the Roman Catholic Church, Eastern Orthodox Church, Anglican Church, Lutheran Church and some ministers and ordained officers of Presbyterian and Reformed churches.

In Western Christianity the cassock is generally close-fitting, but in the Eastern Orthodox Church the outer cassock is quite loose.
name: Cassock
Security Guard
description: A [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Security_guard]security guard[/url], or security officer, is a person who is paid to protect property, assets, or people. They are usually privately and formally employed civilian personnel. Security officers are generally uniformed and act to protect property by maintaining a high-visibility presence to deter illegal and inappropriate actions, observing for signs of crime, fire or disorder; then taking action and reporting any incidents to their client and emergency services as appropriate.

name: Captain
description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain]captain[/url].

A captain is the commanding person in charge of a ship, aircraft or similar vessel.

name: Merchant
description: A merchant is a businessperson who trades in commodities produced by others, in order to earn a profit.

name: Friend
description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Friend]friend[/url] of someone.

In a comparison of personal relationships, friendship is considered to be closer and more intimate than association. Friendships is often the result of a friend demonstrating the tendency to desire what is best for the other, sympathy, empathy, honesty, mutual understanding and compassion, trust in one another and positive reciprocity.

This character performs urethral sounding. Apply i1449 to the receiving character.

Urethral play can involve the introduction of either soft or rigid items into the meatus of the penis (as well as farther in). This action in the male may be directly or indirectly associated with stimulation of the prostate gland and some types of bladder control.
name: Urethral Sounding

description:
This character wears crotchless [url=https://vndb.org/i1235]leggings[/url].

Crotchless leggings are like leggings but leaving the crotch area open.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/88/90588.jpg]NSFW Example[/url]
name: Crotchless Leggings
Slave Tattoo (BDSM)
description:
This character has a [url=https://desade.online/bdsm-tattoo-designs/]slave tattoo (BDSM)[/url].

This kind of tattoo is used to emphasize the fact that a character is submissive to or owned by their master. Common slave tattoo designs include barcodes, hearts, or chains. A barcode would suggest they are property. Hearts means that the slave's heart belongs to their master.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/19/101319.jpg]NSFW Barcode Example[/url]
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/21/101321.jpg]NSFW Heart Example[/url]

name: Erotic Spanking
description:
This character is subject to erotic spanking. Apply [url=/i1688]i1688[/url] to the character spanking this character.

Erotic spanking is the act of spanking another person for the sexual arousal or gratification of either or both parties.

A character with this trait possesses a Shimada hairstyle.

The [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shimada_%28hairstyle%29]Shimada[/URL] is a women's hairstyle in Japan, similar to a [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chignon_%28hairstyle%29]chignon[/URL]. Its modern usage is mainly limited to geisha (wearing it as a wig), but during the Edo period it was also worn by ordinary women, and especially by girls in their late teens. Generally the hair is gathered together at the crown of the head and a small portion of the bun is sectioned off to point outward.
name: Shimada

description:
This character [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drug_abuse]abuses drugs[/url].

Substance abuse refers to a maladaptive pattern of use of a substance that is not considered dependent. The term "drug abuse" does not exclude dependency, but is otherwise used in a similar manner in nonmedical contexts.

This trait is intended for characters that are addicted to drugs, do not use it for everyone that takes a pill once or twice in a story.
name: Drug Abuse
Yukata
description:
This character wears a yukata.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yukata]yukata[/url] is a casual summer kimono. Yukata are worn at Japanese inns after bathing and outdoor summer events such as fireworks displays and bon-odori festivals.

name: Pet Collar
description:
A character with this trait wears a pet collar.

A [URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Collar_(animal)]pet collar[/URL] is a piece of material put around the neck of certain pet animals, such as dogs or cats, for control, identification, or other purposes. Identification tags and medical information is often placed on collars. Collars are also useful for controlling the animal, as they provide a handle for grabbing or means of leading.

[URL=https://vndb.org/c9473]Example 1[/URL]
[URL=https://vndb.org/c14653]Example 2[/URL]
[URL=https://vndb.org/c54555]Example 3[/URL]

NOTE: This trait is intended for [pet] animals wearing collars, not humans wearing collars in a slavery and/or sexual context.

For collars worn in slavery contexts (including in sexual contexts), please use [URL=https://vndb.org/i2465]Slave Collar[/URL]. 
For collar-styled neck accessories (usually worn by humans), please use [URL=https://vndb.org/i1568]Choker[/URL].

name: Bob Cut
description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_cut]bob cut hairstyle[/url].

A "bob cut" is a short haircut for men and women in which the hair is typically cut straight around the head at about jaw-length, often with a fringe (or "bangs") at the front.

name: Shield
description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shield]shield[/url].

A shield is a type of personal armor, meant to intercept attacks, either by stopping projectiles such as arrows or redirecting a hit from a sword, mace or battle axe to the side of the shield-bearer.

Shields vary greatly in size, ranging from large panels that protect the user's entire body to small models (such as the buckler) that were intended for hand-to-hand-combat use.

name: Pirate
description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soldier]pirate[/url].

A pirate is a perpetrator who paretakes in criminal acts of violence, detention, rape, or depredation committed for private ends by the crew or the passengers of a private ship or aircraft that is directed on the high seas against another ship, aircraft, or against persons or property on board a ship or aircraft.

name: Duel
description:
This character was involved in a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Duel]duel[/url].

Historically, a duel is an arranged engagement in combat between two individuals, with matched weapons in accordance with agreed-upon rules.
The duel was based on a code of honour. Duels were fought not so much to kill the opponent as to gain "satisfaction", that is, to restore one's honour (or compete for a woman) by demonstrating a willingness to risk one's life for it, and as such the tradition of duelling was originally reserved for the male members of nobility.

You can also use this trait for non-armed duels (competitive, for example), as long as this is a question of a honour, with possible significant risk to lose something or someone important for a duelist.

name: Four-Legged
description:
This characther is a [url=https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/quadruped]quadruped[/url] has four legs and walks and stands on four feet.

This trait can be used for quadruped animals but also for hybrid mythological monsters and monster girls having the lower body of a quadruped and the upper body of an humanoid, like for example a centaur.

name: Glowing
description:
At least one of this character's eyes glow.

Only apply this to a character whose eyes are normally glowing. Don't apply this to characters whose eyes only glow occasionally, such as when they use magic.

name: Veil
description:
This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Veil]veil[/url].

A veil is an article of clothing, worn almost exclusively by women, that is intended to cover some part of the head or face.

One view is that as a religious item, it is intended to show honor to an object or space. The actual sociocultural, psychological, and sociosexual functions of veils have not been studied extensively but most likely include the maintenance of social distance and the communication of social status and cultural identity. In Islamic society, various forms of the veil have been adopted from the Arab culture in which Islam arose.
This is a meta trait to gather traits related to the type of a character's hair.
name: Type
Fisherman
description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fisherman]fisherman[/url].

A fisherman or fisher is someone who captures fish and other animals from a body of water, or gathers shellfish.

This character wears a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bodystocking]bodystocking[/url].

A bodystocking is a one-piece article of lingerie that covers the torso, and sometimes legs and arms of the wearer. It is similar to a leotard or a catsuit. The key difference is that it is usually made from partially transparent materials. Despite being quite erotic there are visual novels where heroines wear it as their main clothes.

description: String instruments are musical instruments that produce sound from vibrating strings. In most strings instruments, the vibrations are transmitted to the body of the instrument, which also vibrates, along with the air inside it. In the Hornbostel-Sachs scheme of musical instrument classification, used in organology, they are called chordophones. Some common instruments in the string family are violin, guitar, sitar, electric bass, viola, cello, harp, double bass, rabab, banjo, mandolin, ukulele, and bouzouki.
name: String Instrument
Assassin
description:
This character is an [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assassin]assassin[/url].

An assassin is a highly skilled and trained murderer, usually someone who kills a politically prominent person, or someone of similar importance, for fanatical or monetary reasons.

This character has sex in the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spoons_sex_position]spoons[/url] position. Apply this trait to the penetrating partner and apply [url=/i98]i98[/url] to the penetrated partner.

In this position, the receiving partner lies on their side, while the penetrating partner also lies on their side, behind the receiving partner, facing the same direction. The participants may or may not press their upper bodies together.

Slave Owner
description:
This character owns [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slavery]slaves[/url] or engages in capturing and trading slaves.

Slavery is a system under which people are treated as property and are forced to work. Slaves can be held against their will from the time of their capture, purchase or birth, and deprived of the right to leave, to refuse to work, or to demand compensation. In some historical situations it has been legal for owners to kill slaves.

This character plays [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_football]American football[/url].

American football is a sport played by two teams of eleven players on a rectangular field with goalposts at each end. The offense, the team with control of the oval-shaped football, attempts to advance down the field by running with or passing the ball, while the team without control of the ball, the defense, aims to stop their advance and take control of the ball for themselves. The offense must advance at least ten yards in four downs, or plays, or else they turn over the football to the opposing team; if they succeed, they are given a new set of four downs. Points are primarily scored by advancing the ball into the opposing team's end zone for a touchdown or kicking the ball through the opponent's goalposts for a field goal. The team with the most points at the end of a game wins.
name: American Football
Nurarihyon
description:
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nurarihyon]Nurarihyon[/url] is a Japanese youkai, considered to be the leader of all youkai. He is usually depicted as an old man with a gourd-shaped head and wearing a kesa. 

The Nurarihyon will sneak into someone's house while they are away, drink their tea, and act as if it is their own house. Because it looks human, anyone who sees him will mistake him for the owner of the house, making it very hard to expel him.

description:
This character competes in or engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surfing]Surfing[/url]

Surfing is a surface water sport in which the wave rider, referred to as a "surfer," rides on the forward face of a wave, which is most often carrying the surfer towards shore. Waves suitable for surfing are found primarily in the ocean, but can be found in some lakes, in rivers in the form of a standing wave or tidal bore. Surfing can also be done in manmade sources such as wave pools and boat wakes. The term "surfing" refers to the act of riding a wave and not the form (with or without a board) in which the wave is ridden. For instance, the native peoples of the Pacific surfed waves on alaia, paipo, and other such crafts on their belly, knees, and feet. Not to mention, Bodysurfing, the act of surfing a wave without a board, is considered by some to be the purest form of surfing. That much said, the more modern day definition of surfing tends to refer to when a surfer rides a wave standing up on a surfboard, which is referred to as stand-up surfing or paddleboarding. Although, another prominent form of surfing in the ocean today includes bodyboarding, which refers to when a surfer rides a wave either on the belly, dropknee, or stand-up on a bodyboard. Not to mention, knee boarding, surfmatting (riding inflatable mats), foils, bodysurfing, and so forth.
name: Surfing
Nun
description:
This character is a [URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nun]nun[/URL].

A nun is a member of a religious community of women, typically one living under vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience. She may have decided to dedicate her life to serving all other living beings, or she might be an ascetic who voluntarily chose to leave mainstream society and live her life in prayer and contemplation in a monastery or convent. 

The term "nun" is applicable to Catholics (eastern and western traditions), Orthodox Christians, Anglicans, Lutherans, Jains, Buddhists, Taoists, Hindus and some other religious traditions.

This character has an appearance similar to the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ganguro]ganguro[/url] fashion.

Ganguro is an alternative fashion trend of blonde, pink or silver hair and tanned skin among young Japanese women that peaked in popularity around the year 2000. The Shibuya and Ikebukuro districts of Tokyo were the centers of ganguro fashion. In contradiction to the traditional Japanese concept of beauty by having pale skin, dark hair, and neutral makeup tones, rebellious youth tanned their skin, bleached their hair, and used colourful makeup. There is a connection to Japanese folklore of ghosts and demons, who are depicted with a similar appearance and often displayed in kabuki and noh costumes. This connection to folklore is further noted in the ganguro offshoot style called yamanba, named after a famous story about a mountain witch. The term ganguro is a portmanteau of the Japanese word gangan-kuro (ガンガン黒), meaning extremely dark, and guro (グロ), meaning grotesque, and the word ganguro can also be translated as "blackface".
name: Ganguro

description:
This character engages in [url=http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/disguise]disguise[/url].

Disguising characters change their appearance or guise of so as to conceal identity or mislead, as by means of deceptive garb.

A disguise can be anything which conceals or changes a person's physical appearance, including a wig, glasses, makeup, costume or other ways. Hats, glasses, change in hair style or wigs, plastic surgery, and make-up are also used. 

Disguises are used by criminals such as bank robbers and by spies seeking to avoid identification. A well-known person or celebrity may choose to go "incognito" in order to avoid unwelcome press attention.

This trait is intended for characters changing their appearance to pretend to be someone else, for other types of changes use the transformation trait family.
name: Disguise

description:
This character is an idealist, someone who is absorbed with living life the way they perceive it should be. They purposely overlook the darkness of human nature in favor of seeing everyone in an unrealistically good light. To an idealist, there are no such things as bad people. There are only bad situations people are in that force them to act a certain way. Finally, an idealist is someone who expects the best from people, not realizing that not everyone is willing to give up their time or money as willing as they are.

The opposite of a cynic, an idealist often has the nature of selflessness and believes in things like honor, justice, honesty, etc.
name: Idealist

At times, a stripper may be hired to perform at a bachelor party or other private event. There are different types of strippers: a house dancer works for a particular club or franchise, while a feature dancer tends to have her own celebrity, touring a club circuit making appearances. 

Most strippers are female, with only 8 percent being male.

A swimsuit is an item of clothing designed to be worn while engaging in a water-based activity or water sports, such as swimming, water polo, diving, surfing, water skiing, or during activities in the sun, such as sun bathing.

A swimsuit can also be worn as an undergarment in sports that require a wetsuit such as water skiing, scuba diving, surfing, and wakeboarding. Swimsuits are also worn when there is a need to display the body, as in the case of beauty pageants, or bodybuilding contests. name: Manslaughter
description:
This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manslaughter]manslaughter[/url].

Manslaughter is a legal term for the killing of a human being, in a manner considered by law as less culpable than murder.

The law generally differentiates between levels of criminal culpability based on the mens rea, or state of mind. This is particularly true within the law of homicide, where murder requires either the intent to kill – a state of mind called malice, or malice aforethought – or the knowledge that one's actions are likely to result in death; manslaughter, on the other hand, requires a lack of any prior intention to kill or create a deadly situation.

DJ
description:
A disc jockey, also known as [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DJ]DJ[/url], is a person who plays recorded music for an audience.

There are several types of disc jockeys. Radio DJs or radio personalities introduce and play music that is broadcast on AM, FM, shortwave, digital, or internet radio stations. Club DJs select and play music in bars, nightclubs, or discothèques, or at parties or raves, or even in stadiums. Hip hop DJs select and play music using multiple turntables to back up one or more MCs/rappers, perform turntable scratching to create percussive sounds, and are also often music producers who use turntablism and sampling to create backing instrumentals for new tracks. In reggae, the DJ is a vocalist who raps, "toasts", or chats over pre-recorded rhythm tracks while the individual choosing and playing them is referred to as a selector. Mobile DJs travel with portable sound systems and play recorded music at a variety of events.

description: [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Relocation_(personal)]Relocation[/url], also known as moving, is the process of vacating a fixed location (such as a residence or business) and settling in a different one. A move can be to a nearby location within the same neighborhood, a much farther location in a different city, or sometimes a different country. It usually includes packing up all belongings, transferring to the new home, and unpacking, as well as administrative or bureaucratic tasks, such as changing registration data, change of insurance, services etc.
name: Moving

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Butler]butler[/url].

A butler is a servant in a large rich household. The butler is in charge of food service, wine, spirits, and silver, supervises other servants, and may perform a wide array of household management duties. A butler is usually male, and in charge of male servants, while a housekeeper is usually a woman, and in charge of female servants.
name: Butler
Roommate
description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roommate]roommate[/url].

A roommate is a person who shares a living facility such as an apartment or dormitory.

A domestic partner is different from a roommate since it signifies an intimate relationship while the later doesn't.

This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cheerleader]cheerleader[/url].

Cheerleading is a physical activity, sometimes a competitive sport, based on organized routines, usually ranging from one to three minutes, which contain the components of tumbling, dance, jumps, cheers, and stunting to direct spectators of events to cheer on sports teams at games or to participate in competitions.

While cheerleaders are usually students cheering for their school's teams, there are also non-student cheerleaders supporting professional sports clubs and similar.

description:

In law, treason is the crime that covers some of the more serious acts of betrayal of one's sovereign or nation. Historically, treason also covered the murder of specific social superiors, such as the murder of a husband by his wife. Treason against the king was known as high treason and treason against a lesser superior was petit-treason. A person who commits treason is known in law as a traitor.
name: Treason

Torture is any act by which severe pain or suffering, whether physical or mental, is intentionally inflicted on a person for such purposes as obtaining from him, or a third person, information or a confession, punishing him for an act he or a third person has committed or is suspected of having committed, or intimidating or coercing him or a third person, or for any reason based on discrimination of any kind, when such pain or suffering is inflicted by or at the instigation of or with the consent or acquiescence of a public official or other person acting in an official capacity. It does not include pain or suffering arising only from, inherent in, or incidental to, lawful sanctions. 

[From UN Convention Against Torture]

name: Wings
description:

Wings are either of the two forelimbs of most birds and of bats, corresponding to the human arms, that are specialized for flight or adapted for swimming, as in penguins. Or one of the paired, thin, lateral extensions of the body wall of an insect, located on the mesothorax and the metathorax, by means of which it flies. And in fiction, a similar structure with which gods, angels, demons, etc., are conceived to be provided for the purpose of flying.

name: Infamous
description:
This character is infamous, someone who is known for a reputation that's not exactly regarded positively in public eyes.

The counterpart of being famous, this character is well known for some bad quality or deed. Note that being infamous does not mean one is automatically a criminal or villain or evil, many infamy can be created due to the character's reputation, wide spread rumors, and/or the person being misunderstood, the same as how positive fame is spread, only towards a more negative note.

ex. being a lone wolf that is well known for some reputation yet most people hesitate to interact with him/her due to said reputation and/or maybe along with their intimidating air, but in fact that person may have a heart of gold or is just misunderstood.

On the other hand, it's also possible for one person to be both famous and infamous at the same time, being well known and revered to positively on one hand in one group, while at the same time resented or feared by some other group of people or even seen as an outcast with a formidable and/or notorious reputation.

On another note, many criminals and villains usually have a reputation of infamy. However, it should be noted that although criminals, villains, and generally evil characters are usually infamous, infamy does not automatically mark someone as evil as explained above. Many anti-heroes can have a degree of infamy, the same as how a villain can actually be famous positively but it's actually a mask to hide their true selves and goals as well as using the public to their advantage.

name: Cross
description:
This character carries a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christian_cross]christian cross[/url].

The Christian cross, seen as a representation of the instrument of the crucifixion of Jesus Christ, is the best-known religious symbol of Christianity. It is related to the crucifix (a cross that includes a usually three-dimensional representation of Jesus' body) and to the more general family of cross symbols.

Do not mix with the necklace version, [url=http://vndb.org/i159]Cross Necklace[/url] or other crosses that appear on clothing or as accessories. This trait is for a larger cross that is held on the hand or hung on a wall.

This character is a cow or has cow-like physical features.

Cows are members of the bovine family. They commonly live on farms and are raised as livestock for meat, as dairy animals for milk and other dairy products, and as draft animals.

description:
This character has [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inferiority_complex]inferiority complex[/url].

An inferiority complex, in the fields of psychology and psychoanalysis, is a feeling that one is inferior to others in some way.

Such feelings can arise from an imagined or actual inferiority in the afflicted person. It is often subconscious, and is thought to drive afflicted individuals to overcompensate, resulting either in spectacular achievement or extreme schizotypal behavior, or both.

Unlike a normal feeling of inferiority, which can act as an incentive for achievement (or promote discouragement), an inferiority complex is an advanced state of discouragement, often embedding itself into one's lifestyle, and sometimes resulting in a retreat from difficulties.
name: Inferiority Complex

A shotgun is a firearm that is usually designed to be fired from the shoulder, which uses the energy of a fixed shell to fire a number of small spherical pellets called shot, or a solid projectile called a slug.

This character is hotblooded.

Hotblooded characters feel extremely passionate about something, for example justice, love or protecting someone. This passion is to such a degree that nothing can stop the hotblooded character from reaching it, not the laws of physics nor death.

They usually appear in stories in the form of heroes or villains that refuse to stop or die no matter what, unless their will is broken.

Kemonomimi, literally meaning "animal ears", is based on the the concept of drawing animals as bishoujo or having bishoujo wear or have animal accessories (such as ears or tails). Catgirls are the most prolific in this category, although bunnygirls, foxgirls, and dog girls are also common.

Kemonomimi characters typically appear human except for added animal-like qualities.

This trait is intended for characters with hair styles that look like animal ears. And it should not be mixed with the other two kemonomimi traits:
Clothes > [url=http://vndb.org/i153]Kemonomimi Headband[/url] refers to characters wearing head accessories animal ears and
Body > [url=http://vndb.org/i677]Kemonomimi[/url] refers to humanoid characters with actual animal ears.

name: Amputation
description:
This character loses a limb to [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amputation]amputation[/url].

Amputation is the removal of a body extremity by trauma or surgery.

As a surgical measure, it is used to control pain or a disease process in the affected limb, such as malignancy or gangrene. In some cases, it is carried out on individuals as a preventative surgery for such problems. A special case is the congenital amputation, a congenital disorder, where foetal limbs have been cut off by constrictive bands.

In some countries, amputation of the hands or feet is or was used as a form of punishment for people who committed crimes. Amputation has also been used as a tactic in war and acts of terrorism; it may also occur as a war injury. In some cultures and religions, minor amputations or mutilations are considered a ritual accomplishment.

A transplant or a prosthesis are the only options for recovering the loss.

description:
A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percussion]percussion instrument[/url] is a musical instrument that is sounded by being struck or scraped by a beater (including attached or enclosed beaters or rattles); struck, scraped or rubbed by hand; or struck against another similar instrument. The percussion family is believed to include the oldest musical instruments, following the human voice.

The percussion section of an orchestra most commonly contains instruments such as timpani, snare drum, bass drum, cymbals, triangle and tambourine. However, the section can also contain non-percussive instruments, such as whistles and sirens, or a blown conch shell. On the other hand, keyboard instruments, such as the celesta, are not normally part of the percussion section, but keyboard percussion instruments such as the glockenspiel and xylophone (which do not have piano keyboards) are included.
name: Percussion Instruments

The style sometimes features a ribbon-like binding around the low tops of the slipper and may have a slight gathering at the top-front of the vamp (toe box) and a tiny, decorative string tie. Ballet slippers can be adjusted and tightened to the wearer's foot by means of this string tie and done.

Fashion, a general term for a currently popular style or practice, especially in clothing, foot wear or accessories. Fashion references to anything that is the current trend in look and dress up of a person.

description:
This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cosplay]cosplay[/url].

Cosplay is a type of performance art in which participants don costumes and accessories to represent a specific character or idea. Characters are often drawn from popular fiction in Japan, but recent trends have included American cartoons and Sci-Fi. Favorite sources include manga, anime, tokusatsu, comic books, graphic novels, video games, hentai and fantasy movies. Any entity from the real or virtual world that lends itself to dramatic interpretation may be taken up as a subject. Inanimate objects are given anthropomorphic forms and it is not unusual to see genders switched, with women playing male roles and vice versa.

Cosplayers often interact to create a subculture centered around role play. A broader use of the term cosplay applies it to any costumed role play in venues apart from the stage, regardless of the cultural context.
name: Cosplay

description:
This character is in a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domestic_partnership]domestic partnership[/url].

A domestic partnership is a legal or personal relationship between two individuals who live together and share a common domestic life but are neither joined by marriage nor a civil union.

A domestic partner is different from a roommate since it signifies an intimate relationship while the later doesn't.
name: Domestic Partner

description:
This character has been seen with a [URL=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cigar]cigar[/URL].

A cigar is a tightly-rolled bundle of dried and fermented tobacco that is ignited so that its smoke may be drawn into the mouth.

A [url=/i1144]cigarette[/url] is distinguished from a cigar by its smaller size, use of processed leaf, and paper wrapping, which is normally white. Cigars are typically much larger than cigarettes, composed entirely of whole-leaf tobacco and not wrapped in paper.
name: Cigar

To be treated as livestock is different from [url=https://vndb.org/i1370]petplay[/url] in that the characters are used for agricultural purposes such as for labor, breeding, or the production of milk.

They may be kept in [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pen_(enclosure)]pens[/url], on farms, or in barns or allowed to roam free but treated as livestock nonetheless. They may be bought or sold as livestock without any regard to their human rights.

description:
A character with this tag has a haraguro personality.

A haraguro character is one who has an outward appearance of being amicable, friendly, innocent, kind and/or refreshing, but uses any combination of the aforementioned traits to hide their real cruel, cunning, evil, manipulative, mean and/or sadistic side. 

Despite the negative connotation, not all haraguro are villainous or are sociopaths. Their motives vary very widely depending upon the character her/himself and the "seriousness" of the story. 

The term comes from the Japanese word, "Haraguroi (腹黒い)", which means "black-hearted; mean; scheming".

description:
This character has a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stinger]stinger[/url].

A stinger, or sting, is a sharp organ found in various animals capable of injecting venom, usually by piercing the skin of the victim. Technically, a stinger is the part of an insect or animal that holds a sting, where a sting is the pointed organ, but in common language those terms are used interchangeably.

Well-known animals with sitngers are: hornets, some ants, centipedes, and scorpions.

The longsword is a type of European sword used during the late medieval period, approximately 1350 to 1550. Longswords have long cruciform hilts with grips over 10 to 15 cm length (providing room for two hands). Straight double-edged blades are often over 1 m to 1.2 m length, and weigh typically between 1.2 and 2.4 kg, with light specimens just below 1 kg, and heavy specimens just above 2 kg.

A ward is someone placed under the protection of a legal guardian.

A mobile phone is an electronic device used to make mobile telephone calls across a wide geographic area. Mobile phones are different from cordless telephones, which only offer telephone service within a limited range of a fixed land line, for example within a home or an office.
name: Mobile Phone

Uwabaki are a type of Japanese slippers worn indoors at home, school or certain companies and public buildings where street shoes are prohibited. Uwabaki are light, flexible shoes which are easy to slip on and off, designated for indoor use. 

As they are not generally worn outside, the soles are kept clean, and thus cleaning and maintenance of the building's floors are kept to a minimum.
name: Uwabaki

Mostly used for the experts of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_tactics]military tactics[/url], the art of organizing an army, are the techniques for using weapons or military units in combination for engaging and defeating an enemy in battle. But also applies to characters that use maneuvers or follow plans to achieve a particular aim in in non-battle situations.

A ninja is a covert agent or mercenary from feudal Japan specializing in unorthodox arts of war. The functions of the ninja includes espionage, sabotage, infiltration, and assassination, as well as open combat in certain situations.
name: Ninja

Not to be confused with [url=https://vndb.org/i986]strapless shirt[/url], which is a tank top without straps.

A cigarette is a small cylinder of finely cut tobacco leaves rolled in thin paper for smoking. The cigarette is ignited at one end and allowed to smoulder; its smoke is inhaled from the other end, which is held in or to the mouth and in some cases a cigarette holder may be used as well. Most modern manufactured cigarettes are filtered and include reconstituted tobacco and other additives.

A cigarette is distinguished from a [url=/i1145]cigar[/url] by its smaller size, use of processed leaf, and paper wrapping, which is normally white. Cigars are typically much larger than cigarettes, composed entirely of whole-leaf tobacco and not wrapped in paper.

The katana is characterized by its distinctive appearance: a curved, slender, single edged blade with a length of greater than 60 cm, circular or squared guard, and long grip to accommodate two hands. It has historically been associated with the samurai of feudal Japan, and has become renowned for its sharpness and cutting ability.

This character engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ballet]ballet[/url].

Ballet is a type of performance dance, that originated in the Italian Renaissance courts of the 15th century. It's a form of classical dance that's seemingly gymnastic and acrobatic often preformed to formal classical music.

Prussia was a historic state originating out of the Duchy of Prussia and the Margraviate of Brandenburg, and centered on the region of Prussia. Prussia, with its capital in Königsberg and from 1701 moved to Berlin, shaped the history of Germany. Prussia existed until its formal liquidation by the Allied Control Council Enactment No. 46 of 25 February 1947.

Games and series with Prussian characters are almost always set in the history, or deal with historical themes.

Pantalettes are undergarments covering the legs worn by women, girls, and very young boys (before they were breeched) in the early- to mid-19th century.

Pantalettes originated in France in the early 19th century, and quickly spread to Britain and America. Pantalettes were a form of leggings or long drawers. They could be one-piece or two separate garments, one for each leg, attached at the waist with buttons or laces. The crotch was left open for hygiene reasons. They were most often of white linen fabric and could be decorated with tucks, lace, cutwork or broderie anglaise.

The term Spanish people (or Spaniards) has two distinct meanings: Traditionally, it applies to people native to any part of Spain. More recently, it has also come to have a legal meaning, referring to people who hold Spanish citizenship.

Underweight is a term describing a human whose body weight is considered too low to be healthy. A person may be underweight due to genetics, metabolism, lack of food (frequently due to poverty), or illness.

Electric guitars, introduced in the 1930s, rely on an amplifier that can electronically manipulate tone. Early amplified guitars employed a hollow body, but a solid body was found more suitable.

Electric guitars have had a continuing profound influence on popular culture. Guitars are recognized as a primary instrument in genres such as blues, bluegrass, country, flamenco, jazz, jota, mariachi, reggae, rock, soul, and many forms of pop.
name: Electric Guitar

Genetics deals with the molecular structure and function of genes, with gene behavior in the context of a cell or organism (e.g. dominance and epigenetics), with patterns of inheritance from parent to offspring, and with gene distribution, variation and change in populations. Given that genes are universal to living organisms, genetics can be applied to the study of all living systems, from viruses and bacteria, through plants (especially crops) and domestic animals, to humans (as in medical genetics).

A jacket is a type of sleeved hip- or waist-length garment for the upper body. Copared to a coat, a jacket is generally shorter, ending just below the waist, and often lighter.

Hold-ups or stay-ups (in the USA also referred to as thigh-highs) are stockings with a band of elastic sewn to the top, designed to hold the stockings up when worn, without the need for a garter belt or garters.

If the stockings are held up with a garter belt, use [url=https://vndb.org/i607]Garter Belt[/url] instead of this trait.

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rocket_launcher]rocket launcher[/url] is any device that launches a rocket-propelled projectile, although the term is often used in reference to mechanisms that are portable and capable of being operated by an individual.

A quiver is a container for arrows, crossbow bolts or darts, such as those fired from a bow, crossbow or blowgun. It can be carried on an archer's body, the bow, or the ground, depending on the type of shooting and the archer's personal preference. Quivers were traditionally made of leather, wood, furs, and other natural materials, but are now often made of metal or plastic.

A journalist collects and disseminates information about current events, people, trends, and issues. His or her work is acknowledged as journalism.

Reporters are one type of journalist. They create reports as a profession for broadcast or publication in mass media such as newspapers, television, radio, magazines, documentary film, and the Internet.

Medical gloves are disposable gloves used during medical examinations and procedures that help prevent contamination between caregivers and patients. Medical gloves are made of different polymers including latex, nitrile rubber, vinyl and neoprene.

A bolo tie  is a type of necktie consisting of a piece of cord or braided leather with decorative metal tips or aglets (aiguillettes) secured with an ornamental clasp or slide.

The term combat (French for fight) typically refers to armed conflict between military forces in warfare, whereas the more general term "fighting" can refer to any violent conflict. Combat violence can be unilateral, whereas fighting implies at least a defensive reaction.

The sokutai (束帯) is complex attire only worn by courtiers, aristocrats and the emperor at the court in Japan. Part of a sokutai are the shaku (笏), a flat ritual baton or sceptre, and a hat called kanmuri (冠) .

No longer in normal use, the sokutai is however still worn by imperial court members and government officials (including the Prime Minister) on rare occasions such as weddings and enthronement ceremonies.

A hoodie is a sweatshirt with a hood. The characteristic design includes large frontal pockets, a hood, and (usually) a drawstring to adjust the hood opening. They are sometimes worn with sweatpants.

This character wears [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suspenders]suspenders[/url].

Suspenders or braces are fabric or leather straps worn over the shoulders to hold up trousers. Straps may be elasticated, either entirely or only at attachment ends and most straps are of woven cloth forming an X or Y shape at the back. Braces are typically attached to trousers with buttons using leather tabs at the ends or with clips.

name: Mohawk
description:
The character sports a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohawk_hairstyle]Mohawk hairstyle[/url].

The mohawk (referred to in British English as a mohican) is a hairstyle in which, in the most common variety, both sides of the head are shaven, leaving a strip of noticeably longer hair in the center. It is associated mostly with the punk rock subculture, though today mohawks have entered mainstream fashion. The mohawk is also sometimes referred to as an iro in reference to the Iroquois, from whom the hairstyle is derived.

name: Unarmed Fighting
description:
The character with this trait engages in [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hand-to-hand_combat]hand-to-hand combat[/url].

Hand-to-hand combat is a generic term often referring to weaponless fighting conducted from a military based point of view. The phrase "hand-to-hand" indicates unarmed combat but often allows for the consideration of weapons usage and implementation. It is an engagement between two or more persons with or without hand-held weapons such as knives, sticks, or projectile weapons within the range of physical contact.

A character with this trait has been abandoned by a parent, guardian or any other person responsible for this character's care.

[URL=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Child_abandonment]Child abandonment[/URL] is the practice of relinquishing interests and claims over one's offspring in an extralegal way with the intent of never again resuming or reasserting them. An abandoned child is called a foundling (as opposed to a [url=https://vndb.org/i1847]runaway[/url] or an [url=https://vndb.org/i85]orphan[/url]).
name: Child Abandonment
School Drama Club Member
description:
This character is a member of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drama]drama[/url] club associated with a school.

Drama club exists to provide an opportunity for students interested in theater to learn the art of acting and be able to create a performance, starting with the script and ending with decorations. Students create requisite and clothes for the show on their own. However, the purchase of necessary materials is provided at the expense of a school. Club can give performances in school during festivals and holidays.

name: Personal Pronouns
description:
These are the traits about which personal pronoun(s) a character regularly uses.

Unlike the English language, Japanese has a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_pronouns]large number of personal pronouns[/url], differing in use by formality, gender, age, and relative social status of speaker and audience.

name: Sexual Slavery (Choukyou Variation)
description:
This character is subject of choukyou-type sexual slavery.

This variation of sexual slavery starts out as non consensual and either turns consensual by bringing out the victim's inner masochist or mindbreak erases most of the victim's original personality to the point, where one cannot really talk about "will" and "consensuality".

name: Cock and Ball Torture Devices
description:
Cock and ball torture devices are used on this character.

[url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cock_and_ball_torture]Cock and ball torture (CBT)[/url] is a sexual activity involving torture of the male genitals. Here a partial list of famous CBT sexual devices:
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/37/88237.jpg]Cock Ring[/url] - [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/49/88249.jpg]Ball Stretcher[/url] - Ball Crusher - [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/39/88239.jpg]Penis Chastity Cage[/url] - [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/48/88248.jpg]Penis Rope[/url] - Testicle Cuffs - Parachute - [url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/38/88238.jpg]Humbler[/url]

The character has sex with an exquisite, high-tech and/or magi-tech machine.

Do NOT use this tag for regular sexual devices, to describe sex with a [url=https://vndb.org/i458]Robot[/url], [url=https://vndb.org/i459]Cyborg[/url] or characters of similar nature.
name: Sex Engine

description:
This character has [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Autism]autism[/url].

Autism is a disorder of neural development characterized by impaired social interaction, by impaired verbal and non-verbal communication, and by restricted, repetitive or stereotyped behavior. The diagnostic criteria require that symptoms become apparent before a child is three years old.

Only use this tag for characters who are explicitly said to be autistic (within the story or by the creators). Do not use it for characters who are simply too shy to properly communicate, for example.
name: Autism
Janitor
description:
This character is a [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janitor]janitor[/url].

A janitor (American English, Scottish English), custodian (British English), janitress (female), cleaner or caretaker is a person who cleans and maintains buildings such as hospitals, schools and residential accommodation. A janitors' primary responsibility is as a cleaner, but in some cases, they will also carry out maintenance and security duties.
This character can speak, but prefers to remain silent as long as he has nothing to say or until someone addressed him. It often reflects his serious or sullen personality.
name: Taciturn
Forced Pregnancy
description:
A character is impregnated without their consent. This usually implies rape and/or sexual slavery, but other methods (through magic or "science") count as well. Whether a baby is born from this pregnancy or not, is irrelevant from the point of view of this traits. The only crucial factor is the clear lack of consensuality.

Please only use this trait when the state of pregnancy is confirmed ingame, either through narration, dialogs or by showing the character pregnant.

The character wears a [url=http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Sarashi]sarashi[/url].

A sarashi is a long strip of cloth, usually thick cotton, wrapped tightly around the midriff up to the chest. Historically worn under kimono both by samurai (to resist injury) and by women (for more "obvious" reasons, particularly in eras when a slim figure was considered fashionable), its association with warriors has made it a near-universal symbol of toughness in Japan.
name: Sarashi

description:
This character is a member of the [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Association_football]soccer[/url] club associated with a school.

A school sports club is a administration-approved student-based school organization focusing on a selected sport. Soccer is a sport played between two teams of eleven players with a spherical ball.
name: School Soccer Club Member

description:
This character is a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twin]twin[/url] brother.

A twin is one of two offspring produced in the same pregnancy. Twins can either be identical (in scientific usage, "monozygotic"), meaning that they develop from one zygote that splits and forms two embryos, or fraternal ("dizygotic") because they develop from two separate eggs that are fertilized by two separate sperm.
name: Twin Brother

description:
This character suffers from [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lisp]lisp[/url].

A lisp, also known as sigmatism, is a speech impediment in which a person cannot articulate sibilants ([s], [z], [ʒ], [ʃ], [tʃ], [dʒ]). These misarticulations often result in unclear speech. This disease is mostly affects children. There are physiological and social factors that may cause a lisp. For example, a long chronic diseases, specific mouth anatomy (including the teeth broken in a fight), the unwillingness of parents to correct the pronunciation of a child, as well as heredity and more.
name: Lisping

description:
This character uses drug, potion, pill, etc. on other(s) to achieve his/her goal, not necessarily related to sexual desire. The receiver usually, but not always, has no knowledge of the act.

This tag isn't for giving medication or prescribed drug to other(s).
name: Drugging

description:
This character has sex in the quickie fix position. Apply this trait to the penetrated partner and apply [url=/i1693]i1693[/url] to the penetrating partner.

This is a variant of the [url=/i1692]doggy[/url] position. The receiving partner stands while bending at the waist and leaning on a piece of furniture, a wall, or their knees for support. The penetrating partner stands behind the receiving partner, possibly holding the receiving partner's hips or hands for support while they thrust.

[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/68/84168.jpg]Example 1[/url]
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/70/84170.jpg]Example 2[/url]
[url=https://s.vndb.org/sf/92/90892.jpg]Example 3[/url]
name: Quickie Fix
Magic Wand
description:
This character is penetrated or otherwise sexually teased by a magic wand. 

A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hitachi_Magic_Wand]Magic Wand[/url] is an electrical, mains-powered vibrating massager, manufactured for relieving tension and relaxing sore muscles. The device is well known for its use as a vibrator, and as a masturbation aid for women, because it functions effectively as a clitoral vibrator and is able to bring women to clitoral orgasm.

Because of the Magic Wand's popularity, various aftermarket attachments with differences in colour, pattern of studs, and material, became available to purchase.

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mule_%28shoe%29]Mule[/url], a French word, is a style of shoe that is backless and closed-toed. Mules can be any heel height - from flat to high. It differs from sandals because they are backless without straps or thongs passing around the ankle or heel. 
A [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slide_%28footwear%29]slide[/url] is a shoe that is backless and open-toed, essentially an open-toed mule.

The sexy version of slides and mules is usually open-toed, with heels. 

Example: [url=http://www.getchu.com/brandnew/709009/c709009charab2.jpg]character wearing sexy mules[/url]
name: Mules

description:
This character becomes a target of [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flirting]flirting[/url].

Flirting is a playful, romantic or sexual overture by one person to another subtly indicating an interest in a deeper relationship with the other person, and can involve verbal communication as well as body language. Body language can include flicking the hair, eye contact, brief touching, open stances, proximity etc. Verbal communication of interest can include the vocal tone, such as pace, volume, intonation. Challenges (teasing, questions, qualifying, feigned disinterest) serve to increase tension, test intention and congruity.

Almost every VN has some romance and relationships, but rarely they do have actual flirting. Use this trait sparingly for only the ones that actually do.
name: Flirting
Dormitory Manager
description: This character is the manager of a [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dormitory]dormitory[/url].

name: Rope Bondage
description:
This character is subject to [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rope_bondage]rope bondage[/url] in a sex scene. Apply this trait to the restrained character(s) and apply [url=/i2026]Engages in (Sexual) >> Rope Bondage[/url] to the unrestrained character(s).
